
Refraction for identifying matter (property of matter):

$$\begin{split} &
\eta 
\stackrel{opt.}{=}
\frac{sin(\alpha)}{\sin(\beta)} = 
\frac{\eta_{\beta}}{\eta_{\alpha}}
\stackrel{prism}{=}
\frac{ \sin[\frac{1}{2}(\varpi + \varsigma_{min})] }{ \sin[\frac{1}{2}\varpi ] } \\&
\stackrel{phys.}{=}
\sqrt{ \epsilon_r \mu_r } = 
\frac{\lambda_{\alpha}}{\lambda_{\beta}} = 
\frac{v_{ph,\alpha}}{v_{ph,\beta}} = 
\frac{1}{2} \frac{\lambda}{d_r} \frac{n}{\cos(\beta)} = 
\sqrt{\left( \frac{n}{2} \frac{\lambda}{d_r} \right)^2 + \sin(\alpha)^2} \\&
\stackrel{dispersion}{=}
\eta(\lambda) = 
\eta(\omega)
\stackrel{anisotropy}{=}
\eta(r)
\end{split}$${#eq-refraction}

$$ % \footnote{Brechkraft}
\textnormal{Vacuum } \iff \eta=1
\newline
f = Focal Length		\qquad
D = Refractive Power (Dioptri)
$$


$n \equiv$ order ("quantum cycle"): 
$$
n = 
\frac{\nu}{c} \Delta s = 
\frac{\Delta\varphi}{2\pi} = 
2 \eta \frac{d_r}{\lambda} \sqrt{\eta^2 - \sin(\alpha)^2} = 
2 \eta \frac{d_r}{\lambda} \cos(\beta) = 
\frac{q}{e_0}
\quad \in \mathbb{N}
$${#eq-order}

$$
v^2 = 
\left( \frac{\nu\lambda}{\eta} \right)^2 = 
\left( \frac{\omega}{k \eta} \right)^2
$$

$$
\left( \frac{\eta}{c} \right) ^2 = 
\epsilon \mu	\qquad
\epsilon = \epsilon_0 \epsilon_r	\qquad
\mu = \mu_0 \mu_r
$$


where:  \
$d_r = r_{x+1} - r_x \coloneqq$ distance in space
$\alpha \coloneqq$ irradiaton angle, incoming radiation direction, from source/sender (Einstrahlungswinkel zur Normalen auf Grenzfläche des Mediums)    \
$\beta \coloneqq$ refraction angle for bented transmitted radiation $A_{t}$ orientation in matter (Durchstrahlungsswinkel zur Normalen aus Grenzfläche ins Medium)
